action.description: The action that DNS Firewall should take on a DNS query when it matches one of the domains in the rule's domain list.

blockOverrideDomain.description: The custom DNS record to send back in response to the query.

blockOverrideTtl.description: The recommended amount of time, in seconds, for the DNS resolver or web browser to cache the provided override record.

blockResponse.description: The way that you want DNS Firewall to block the request.

creationTime.description: The date and time that the rule was created, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

creatorRequestId.description: A unique string defined by you to identify the request.

firewallDomainListId.description: The ID of the domain list that's used in the rule.

firewallRuleGroupId.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule group that you want to retrieve the rules for.

modificationTime.description: The date and time that the rule was last modified, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

priority.description: The setting that determines the processing order of the rules in a rule group.
